questions.question: 1. Human skin has very high tensile strength. It is known that the skin consists of epithelial tissue and two kinds of connective tissue. Which of the following tissues provides the skin strength?

2. A 35-year-old man complains of a severe rhinitis and a loss of the sense of smell for a week. Examination detected in the nasal cavity a large amount of mucus that covered the mucosa and blocked the olfactory receptors. Where in the nasal cavity are these receptors located?
3. A person becomes less receptive to pain   in physically or emotionally straining situations due to activation of:
4. During a surgery performed in abdominal cavity, a surgeon located a ligament of liver, stretching from the anterior abdominal wall (navel) to the inferior surface of liver. What ligament is it?

answers.text: A. Round ligament of the liver
B. Coronary ligament of the liver
C. Falciform ligament of the liver
D. Triangular ligament of the liver
E. Venous ligament of the liver

questions.question: 5. A 52-year-old man presents with fever and pain in the joints. Both of his first metatarsophalangeal articulations   are deformed, swollen, and reddened. Blood urea is high.  The patient is diagnosed with gout. What is the main developmental factor in the pathogenesis of this disease?
6. A man is prescribed an enzymatic drug with cytochrome C. This enzyme intensifies the following process:

7. A patient with signs of intestinal infection  (vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain)  has been presenting with increasing signs of intoxication for three days. Papular rash appeared on the uncovered skin areas and spread to the torso. A doctor suspects pseudotuberculosis.   What laboratory test allows confirming this diagnosis within the first week after the onset of disease?
8. During ventricular systole, the cardiac muscle does not respond to additional stimulation because it is in the phase of:
9. The key reaction of fatty acid synthesis is production  of malonyl-CoA. What metabolite is the source of  malonyl- CoA synthesis?
10. Antileukocytic antibodies are detected in the blood of a patient with leukopenia. What type of Coombs-Gell hypersensitivity reaction developed in this case?

11. Patients with hereditary defect of heme-synthesizing enzymes have red urine and skin that is very sensitive to sunlight.  What hemoglobin   metabolites accumulate in these patients, causing these signs?

12. Renal examination shows the kidney  to be swollen and plethoric, with easily removable capsule. Renal pelvis and calyces are dilated and filled with turbid urine; their mucosa is dull and has hemorrhagic foci. On section the renal tissue is variegated, there are yellow-gray areas surrounded with plethoric and hemorrhagic zone. What disease  can be characterized by such results of macroscopic examination?

13. A with clinical signs patient of a primary   immunodeficiency presents with   functionally disturbed mechanism   of  antigen-presentation   to   the immunocompetent cells. What cells are likely to have structural defects?

14. Parents of a 5-year-old sick girl came to the genetic consultancy. Examination  of the child's karyotype shows 46 chromosome. One of the chromosomes in the 15th pair is longer than normal, because it has fragment of 21st a chromosome attached to it. What type of mutation is observed in the girl?

15. A lab rat has subcutaneously received mercury(II) chloride in the amount of 5 mg/kg. 24 hours later the plasma   creatinine concentration increased several times.   What mechanism of retention azotemia is observed in this case?

answers.text: B. Increased creatinine production in the renal tubules
E. Increased creatinine production in the muscles

questions.question: 16. Experimental stimulation of sympathetic nerve branches that innervate heart caused an increase in the force of heart contractions because the membrane of typical  cardiomyocytes permitted an increase in:

answers.text: D. Calcium and potassium ion influx

questions.question: 17. An experiment was aimed at testing the flexor reflex in a spinal frog, which was initiated by simultaneous stimulation with isolated pre-threshold electrical impulses. The frequency of those impulses was such, that the reflex occurred. What process in the nerve centers can be observed during this experiment?

18. Signs of pellagra (vitamin PP deficiency)  are particularly pronounced in patients with low protein diet, because in the human body the nicotinamide precursor is one of the essential amino acids. Name this amino acid:

19. A 46-year-old woman suffering from cholelithiasis developed jaundice. Her urine became dark yellow, while feces are light-colored. What substance will be the most   increased in concentration in the blood serum in this case?

20. A medical student   was hospitalized into the infectious diseases unit the 2nd day after the disease onset.  The patient infectious mononucleosis. What results of laboratory analysis can confirm this    diagnosis immediately on the day of the hospitalization? on is suspected to have

answers.text: A. Fourfold increase in the number of antibodies to Epstein-Barr virus was detected
B. IgM antibodies to herpes simplex virus were detected
D. IgM antibodies to Epstein-Barr virus were detected

questions.question: 21. Autopsy of the body of a 1.5- year- old child revealed hemorrhagic skin rashes, moderate hyperemia and edema of the nasopharyngeal mucosa, small hemorrhages in the mucosa and internal organs, markedly dystrophic changes in the liver and myocardium, acute necrotic nephrosis, and massive hemorrhages in the adrenal glands. These changes are characteristic of the following disease:

22. Patients with ischemic heart disease are usually prescribed small doses of aspirin. This drug inhibits synthesis  of platelet aggregation     activator, thromboxane A2. What substance is this activator synthesized from?
23. Due to destruction of certain structures of the brainstem an animal has lost its orientation reflexes in response to strong light stimuli. What structures were destroyed?
24. In a hypothetical experiment, the action of a  toxic substance disrupts the mechanism of nerve impulse transmission between neurons. What structure enables this function?
25. A patient with  pulmonary tuberculosis is  prescribed a specific antituberculous antibiotic. Name this drug:

26. A 40-year-old woman with Cushing disease has steroid diabetes.    Biochemical examination      shows hyperglycemia      and hypochloremia.  What process activates in the first place in such patients?

answers.text: B. Glucose transportation into a cell

questions.question: 27. An unconscious man was brought into the admission room. He presents with cold skin, constricted pupils, difficult respiration with Cheyne-Stokes pattern, low blood pressure, overfilled urinary bladder. He was diagnosed with morphine poisoning. What drug should the patient be given as an antagonist in this case?

28. A man, complaining of infertility, has made an appointment with the doctor. He has tall stature, low intelligence, and underdeveloped gonads.  His  oral mucosa epithelium has sex chromatin (1 Barr body). What pathology can be suspected in this case?
29. Influenza progression was later accompanied by   respiratory mycoplasmosis in a 12-year-old boy. What type of infection developed in this case?

30. A patient with periodontitis of the lower molar came to the doctor. It was determined that the inflammatory process spread to the lymph nodes. What lymph nodes were the first to be affected by the inflammatory process?
31. A 45-year-old woman suffers from arterial hypertension with high blood concentration  of angiotensin II.    What  antihypertensive drug is the most recommended in the given case?
32. A patient   presents with steatorrhea. This disorder can be linked to disturbed supply of the intestine with the  following substances:

33. Old burial ground for animal refuse, which has not been in use for the last 50 years, is planned to be given    for housing development. However, the soil analysis detected viable spores of a causative agent of an extremely dangerous disease.   What microorganism is the most likely to remain in the soil for such a long period of time?

34. Examination of the duodenal contents revealed there pear-shaped protozoa with two nuclei and four pairs of flagella. The organisms have two axostyles between the nuclei and a ventral adhesive disc. What protozoan representative was found in the patient?
35. T-lymphocytes are determined to be affected by HIV. In this case viral enzyme reverse transcriptase (RNA-dependent   DNA-polymerase) catalyzes the synthesis of:

answers.text: A. Informational RNA based on the viral protein matrix
B. Viral protein based  on the viral RNA matrix
C. Viral RNA based  on the DNA matrix
D. DNA based  on the viral RNA matrix
E. Viral DNA based on the DNA matrix

questions.question: 36. A 30-year-old woman exhibits signs of virilism (growth of body hair, balding temples, menstrual disorders). This condition can be caused by the overproduction   of the following hormone:

37. An 11-year-old girl is brought to the doctor's office by her mother who states that her daughter has been presenting with weakness and swollen face for 3 days. The mother claims that her daughter had always been healthy and active until  the initiation of symptoms. Upon inquiry, the girl describes a foamy appearance of her urine but denies blood in urine, urinary frequency at night, or pain during urination. Physical examination reveals generalized swelling of the face and pitting edema on the lower limbs. Laboratory   study shows proteinuria and  microscopic hematuria.  Which of the following is the most likely cause of findings in the laboratory study of urine?

answers.text: A. Increased hydrostatic pressure in the Bowman's capsule
D. Increased permeability of the glomerular capillary wall

questions.question: 38. A 40-year-old   during  examination presents  with intensified basal metabolic rate. What hormone, present in excess, leads to such condition

39. During cholecystectomy besides a. cystyca another artery was pulled into the ligature. Ligation of this artery resulted in right-sided necrosis of the liver which led to the death of the patient. What artery was  mistakenly ligated along with a. cystyca?

answers.text: D. Ramus sinister a. hepatica propria
E. Ramus dexter a. hepatica propria

questions.question: 40. Investigation  of an isolated cardiac myocyte determined that it does not generate excitation impulses automatically, which means this cardiac myocyte was obtained from the following cardiac structure:
41. A bioterrorist mailed an envelope with a powder that is suspected to contain anthrax causative agent. This envelope can   remain dangerous   for a long time, because anthrax causative agent:

42. A 62-year-old patient has been hospitalized due to  massive cerebral hemorrhage.  Blood pressure is 70/30 mm Hg, heart rate is 120/min., respiratory rate is 4/min., unconscious, no response to external stimuli. Such condition can be determined as:
43. A risk of cerebral edema arose in a narcotized patient. What drug should be administered in this case?

44. Autopsy of the body of a 9-year-old child   shows numerous irregular defects of varying depth with uneven margins and gray-white films tightly attached to the underlying tissue on the rectal mucosa. What disease can be suspected?

45. A patient for a long time was on an imbalanced diet low in proteins, which resulted in hepatic fatty infiltration. This condition is likely to develop if a certain substance is absent in a person's diet. Name this substance:

46. During hystological analysis of the lymph node located in the posterior neck triangle of an 18-year-old patient, a morphologist detected a cluster of cells, among which there  were isolated multinucleate  Reed-Sternberg cells, large and small Hodgkin's cells,  numerouslymphocytes, isolated plasma cells,  and eosinophils. What disease has developed in the patient?

47. A 9-year-old boy has an acute onset of the disease: sore throat, body temperature of 39.5°C. On the second day diffuse skin rash was detected all over his skin exept for the nasolabial triangle. Examination of oral cavity shows crimson tongue, "flaming pharynx”, necrotic tonsillitis. What diagnosis is the most likely?

48. Due to prolonged stay in the mountains at the altitude of 3000 m above the sea level, a person developed increased oxygen capacity of blood, which was directly caused by intensified production of:
49. Microscopy of a woman's swabs made from vaginal secretions revealed Gram-negative bean-shaped diplococci.   What provisional diagnosis can be made?
50. A patient presents with increascd thickness of alveolar-capillary membrane caused by a pathologic process. The direct consequence will be the reduction of the following value:
51. Pupil dilation occurs when a person steps from a light room into a dark one. What reflex causes such a reaction?
52. To lose some weight a woman has been limiting the amount of products in her diet. Three months later she developed edemas and her diuresis increased. What component deficient the cause of this?

53. Four months after a stroke, a man was brought in for rehabilitation with signs of central paralysis. Objectively, his right arm and leg are immobile, their muscle tone is increased,  local reflexes are intensified. What term should be used to describe the patient's condition in this case?
54. A patient has cardiac rhythm disturbance. ECG shows heart rate of 60/min., prolongation of PQ interval, periodical loss of QRS complex. What cardiac rhythm disturbance is it?

answers.text: A. Second-degree incomplete A V block
D. His' right bundle branch block

questions.question: 55. A patient was diagnosed with alkaptonuria. This pathology is caused  by a defect in the following enzyme:

56. An 18-year-old student presents with enlarged thyroid gland accompanied by  accelerated metabolism and increased heart rate. These signs can be observed during hypersecretion of thyroxin. What organelles of thyroid cells are primarily  responsible for hormone production   and secretion?

57. A 41-year-old man has a history of recurrent attacks of heartbeats (paroxysms), profuse sweating, headaches. Examination revealed hypertension, hyperglycemia, increased basal metabolic rate, and tachycardia. These clinical presentations are typical of the following adrenal pathology:

answers.text: A. Hyperfunction of the adrenal cortex
D. Hypofunction of the adrenal cortex

questions.question: 58. During ascent into mountains a person  develops  increased respiration rate and rapid heart rate. What is the cause of these changes?

answers.text: A. Decrease of O2 partial pressure
B. Increase of CO2 partial pressure
D. Increase of nitrogen content in air

questions.question: 59. A 6-year-old child suffers from delayed growth,  disrupted ossification    processes, decalcification of the teeth. What can be the cause?
60. A woman with a dense area in her mammary gland came to a surgeon. To minimize the trauma to the mammary gland lobule during the operation, the surgeon should make the incision:
61. During examination of a patient a doctor should use anatomical division of anterior abdominal wall into regions for more precise diagnostics. How many such regions can abdomen be divided into?

62. Therapeutics unit of a hospital received a man suffering from hyperacid peptic ulcer disease of the stomach. Which of the listed group of drugs must be used as a part of the complex therapy for this patient?
63. A patient with chronic bronchitis was prescribed  a drug with mucolytic action. Name this drug:

64. A biopsy material was obtained from the arches of the patient's soft palate due to a suspected tumor (macroscopy detected an ulcer with the dense floor). In the biopsy material the following was detected: necrosis of the mucosa with infiltration of the submucosal layer by lymphocytes, epithelioid cells. plasma cells, and single neutrophils.  Notable is the presence of marked endovasculitis and perivasculitis. The described changes are characteristic of:

65. A shepherd, who tended to the flock of sheep with his dogs, gradually developed pain in the chest and bloody expectorations. X-ray revealed spheric helminth larvae in the patient's lungs. Specify the helminth that could be the causative agent of this disease:
66. A patient has problems with peripheral circulation, because of limited arterial blood supply. The affected area is pale and its local temperature is low. This condition is caused by:

67. A family of healthy students, who have arrived from Africa, gave birth to a child with signs of anemia. The child died shortly after. Examination revealed that the child's erythrocytes were abnormally crescent-shaped. The disease   autosomal recessive inheritance has pattern. Determine the genotype of the  child's parents:
68. During local anesthetization the patient has gone into anaphylactic shock.   What drug must be administered to the patient?
69. A patient complains of pain in the upper umbilical region.  On palpation there is a mobile painful intestine. What intestine is being palpated by the doctor?
70. Administration of doxycycline hydrochloride   caused an imbalance in the symbiotic intestinal microflora. Specify the kind of imbalance caused by the antibiotic therapy:

71. Histological examination of the biopsy material obtained from the lower third of the esophagus of a 57-year-old man with the signs of continuous reflux revealed the change of the stratified squamous epithelium to the single- layer columnar glandular epithelium with signs of mucus production. Specify the pathological process in the mucous membrane:

72. A woman, who has been suffering from marked hypertension for 15 years,   has lately developed dyspnea, palpitations, slightly decreased systolic pressure, while diastolic pressure remains the same.   What is the main mechanism of  heart failure development in this case?

answers.text: B. Cardiac overload due to increased vascular resistance
C. Disorder of impulse conduction in the myocardium
D. Cardiac overload due to increased blood volume

questions.question: 73. The level of tissue excitability needs to be measured in an experiment. For this purpose one should determine:

74. Examination of a 56-year-old woman with a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus  revealed a disorder of protein metabolism that in the laboratory blood test values is  manifested  as aminoacidemia, and clinically as delayed wound healing and decreased synthesis of antibodies. Which  of the  following mechanisms  causes  the development of aminoacidemia?

answers.text: A. Increased levels of high-density lipoproteins
C. Decreased concentration of amino acids in blood
E. Increased oncotic pressure in the blood plasma

questions.question: 75. A 3-year-old child has been brought by ambulance to the intensive care  unit of the infectious diseases hospital. On examination the child is in severe condition, skin and mucosa are dry, tissue turgor is reduced. The patient's history states that profuse diarrhea and recurrent vomiting were observed throughout the previous day after the child had eaten food products of poor quality. What type of salt and water imbalance is likely to have developed in the patient?

76. A patient with lobar pneumonia has had body temperature of 39°C with  daily   temperature fluctuations of no more than 1°C for 9 days. This fever can be characterized by the following temperature curve:
77. The cells of   these living  organisms have no membranous organelles and  their genetic material has  no nucleosomal organization. Name these living organisms:
78. UN volunteers have arrived in Nigeria to assist the locals in the aftermath of earthquakes. What drug should they prescribe for individual chemoprophylaxis of malaria?
79. A woman complains of vision impairment. On examination she was found to have obesity and fasting hyperglycemia. What can be the cause of vision impairment in this case?

80. Those organisms, which in the process of evolution failed to develop protection from H2O2, can exist  only in anaerobic conditions.    Which of the following enzymes can break down hydrogen peroxide?
81. Typical manifestations of food poisoning caused by C.botulinum are double vision,  abnormal functioning of the swallowing and breathing.  These symptoms develop as a result:

answers.text: A. Pathogen adhesion to the enterocyte receptors

questions.question: 82. A 64-year-old woman presents with disturbed fine motor function of her fingers, marked muscle rigidity,   and tremor. The neurologist diagnosed her with Parkinson's disease. What brain structures are damaged, resulting in this disease?

83. A patient complains that at the bare mention of the tragic events that once occurred in his life he experiences tachycardia, dyspnea, and an abrupt rise in blood pressure. What structures of the CNS are responsible for these cardiorespiratory reactions in the patient?
84. During acute hemorrhage the body loses not only fluid but also electrolytes.  What substance solution can be used as a simple blood substitute?
85. A patient after disrupted cerebral circulation   has developed paralysis.   Choose  the anticholinesterase drug to be prescribed  in this case:
86. An oncology patient is to undergo a surgery on the descending colon. Name the main source of blood supply to this organ:
87. An 18-year-old patient  has developed candidiasis after the case of pneumonia treated with  B-lactam antibiotic.   What antimycotic  agent should be prescribed?
88. Poisoning caused by botulinum toxin that prevents calcium ions from entering axone nerve endings of motoneurons is lifethreatening because it can lead to:

89. A patient with  myocardial infarction in the acute phase has been hospitalized   into the cardiology unit. To induce platelet lysis in the patient's coronary vessels during the early hours of infarction, the following enzyme should be used:
90. A patient has   developed paroxysmal    ventricular  tachycardia against the of cardiac infarction. What antiarrhythmic drug should be chosen to avoid lowering the cardiac output?

91. A 30-year-old man with diabetes mellitus type I was hospitalized. The patient is    comatose. Laboratory tests    revealed hyperglycemia and ketonemia. What metabolic disorder can be detected in this patient?

92. A   12-year-old child has developed nephritic syndrome 2 weeks after a case of tonsillitis, which is a sign of affected glomerular basement membrane in the kidneys. What mechanism is the most likely to cause the basement membrane damage?

93. A patient with inoperable lung cancer accompanied   by unbearable pain was prescribed an analgesic. Against the background of analgesic therapy the patient developed signs of  intestinal obstruction. What analgesic could have caused this complication?
94. For the study of serum proteins various   physical  and physicochemical methods can be used.  In particular, serum albumins and globulins can be separated by this method:
95. Due to the blockage of the common bile duct (which was radiographically confirmed), the biliary flow to the duodenum  was stopped. We should expect the impairment of:
96. The obstetrician-gynecologist is measuring the pelvis of a pregnant woman. A caliper was used to measure the distance between her iliac crests. What pelvic size was measured?
97. 148.	A 43-year-old patient suffers from acute pancreatitis with disturbed common bile duct potency. What condition can develop in this case?

98. A 67-year-old man with clinical diagnosis pneumosclerosis,  and cardiopulmonary   of chronic bronchitis, decompensation has the biopsy material taken from the suspicious area  in his right bronchus mucosa. Cellular and tissue atypism along with pearly bodies can be  histologically detected. What pathologic process is characterized by the described histological changes?

answers.text: B. Squamous cell  metaplasia of bronchial mucosa
E. Squamous cell  carcinoma of bronchus with keratinization

questions.question: 99. During a  surgery  on the submandibular salivary gland, the patient developed   bleeding.   What  artery, topographically connected with this gland, can cause bleeding?

100. A 30-year-old patient's blood test revealed the   following: erythrocyte count is 6.1012/L, hemoglobin is 10.55 mmol/L. Vaquez's disease was diagnosed. Name the leading part of the pathogenesis in this case:
101. Leading symptoms of primary hyperparathyroidism     are osteoporosis and renal damage, resulting in   urolithiasis development. What substances make up the basis of uroliths in such cases?

102. 18-year-old woman  has a  disproportioned body, wing-like folds on the skin of her neck, underdeveloped ovaries,  the nuclei of her buccal epithelium cells have no Barr bodies. What provisional diagnosis can be made in this case?

answers.text: A. Cri du chat (cat cry) syndrome

questions.question: 103. A newborn presents with weak suckling, frequent vomiting, and hypotonia.  Blood and urine citrulline are very high. What metabolic   process is disturbed?

104. After dehelmintization, a 35-year-old man passed a 3.5 m tapeworm during a bowel movement. A stool examination reveals scolex with four suckers and hooks. Mature proglottids are static with up to 12 primary uterine branches. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

105. Among lymphocytes there is a population of cells that have membrane receptors to IgM, activate in response to certain antigens, reproduce mitotically, differentiate into plasma cells that produce     antibodies (immunoglobulins). Name these cells:
106. A patient consulted a dentist about limited mouth opening (trismus). He has a history of a stab wound of the lower extremity. What infection   can cause these symptoms?

107. The first-aid center has received a victim of a traffic accident diagnosed with closed displaced fracture of the middle third of the thigh. For repositioning of bone fragments the patient received 10 mL of 2% dithylinum solution intravenously, which resulted in prolonged period of apnoea and muscle relaxation. What enzyme is deficient, resulting in such pharmacogenetic enzymopathy?

108. Prolonged taking of a certain medicine    can result in osteoporosis, gastric mucosal erosions, hypokalemia, sodium and water retention,   and decreased blood content   of corticotropine.   Specify this medicine:
109. During autopsy of the body of a man, who had been suffering from mitral stenosis, the lungs are revealed to be dense and brown-colored. What pathologic process had occurred in the lungs?
110. Against the background of prolonged heparin treatment, the patient   developed gastric bleeding. What specific heparin antidote must be used in this case?

111. A sample of ovoid non-mobile bacteria with bipolar staining was obtained from a patient. In the body they form a soft capsule. Inoculated on agar, they grow colonies with an off-white center, surrounded with a  scalloped border, resembling lace. They produce "mice toxin"  What causative  agent has such characteristics?
112. A histological specimen demonstrates a vessel with the wall that consists of endothelium, basement membrane, and loose connective tissue. This vessel belongs to the following type:

113. A specimen of  organ shows poorly delineated  hexagonal lobules surrounding a central vein. The interlobular connective tissue contains embedded triads (an artery, a vein and an excretory duct). What organ is it?

114. Corticosteroid   hormones regulate the adaptation processes of the body as a  whole to environmental changes and ensure the maintenance of  internal homeostasis.  What hormone activates  the hypothalamo-pituitary-adrenal axis?

115. A boy has a large trema between his incisors. It is known that the gene for this anomaly is the dominant one. This boy's natural sister has normal teeth placement. It means that genotypically she is:

116. A   13-year-old  teenager underwent X-ray examination of the hip joint.Examination revealed a 3 mm wide radiolucent zone between the head and the shaft of the femur. This situation should be regarded as:

answers.text: A. Dislocation of the femoral head
C. Fissured fracture of the femoral neck
D. Fracture of the femoral neck

questions.question: 117. Autopsy of a man, who served on a nuclear submarine, pathologies: atrophy anemia,   leukopenia, thrombocytopenia, lymphocytes disintegration in the lymph nodes, spleen, gastrointestinal lymphatic system, and hemorrhages into the adrenal glands. What disease developed in   this nuclear following on a revealed bone (panmyelophthisis), the marrow case?
118. As a result of a craniocerebral injury, a patient presents with decreased skin sensitivity. What area of the cerebral cortex is likely to be damaged?

119. 144.	A 37-year-old woman complains of headache, vertigo, troubled sleep, numbness of limbs. For the last 6 years she has been working at the gas- discharge lamp-producing factory in a lead-processing shop. Blood test findings: low hemoglobin and RBC levels, serum iron concentration several times exceeds the norm. Specify the type of anemia:

120. A patient has gradually developed a skin plaque on his face. In the center of this plaque there are a necrotic patch and an ulcer. Histopathological analysis of the biopsy material reveals proliferation of atypical epithelial cells with large number of pathologic mitoses. What is the most likely diagnosis?
121. A patient suffering from gout was prescribed allopurinol.  What pharmacological  property of allopurinol provides therapeutic effect in this case?

answers.text: A. Deceleration   of pyrimidine nucleotides salvage
B. Acceleration   of nitrogen-containing substances excretion
C. Competitive   inhibition of xanthine oxidase
D. Acceleration of nucleic acids synthesis
E. Acceleration   of pyrimidine nucleotides catabolism

questions.question: 122. Examination of the femoral bone detected  chronic suppurative inflammation of the compact substance and  bone marrow, formation of  bone sequestra. What disease is associated with such changes?

answers.text: B. Giant cell tumor of bone

questions.question: 123. Depression and  emotional disturbances result from the lack of noradrenaline, serotonin, and other biogenic amines in the brain. Their levels in the synapses can be  increased  through administration of antidepressants that inhibit the following enzyme:
124. Name the   supramolecular multienzyme complex that is integrated into the lipid layer of inner mitochondrial membrane that creates conditions for redox reactions:

125. An uconscious young man in the state of morphine intoxication has been brought into an admission room. The patient's respiration is slow and   shallow due to suppression of the respiratory center. What kind of respiratory failure occurred in this case?
126. A 3-year-old child had eaten some strawberries. Soon he developed a rash and itching. What was found in the child's leukogram?
127. A 35-year-old patient has been administered    a depolarizing muscle relaxant during a surgery.   Name this drug:

128. Examination of boy's external genitalia revealed a full closure of the upper part of urethra. The urethral canal remains open only from below, as a small fissure. What developmental anomaly of the external genitalia  can be observed in this case?
129. Blood pressure of an adult person has dropped from 120/70 to 90/50 mm Hg, which caused a reflex vasoconstriction. In what organ will the   vasoconstriction be minimal?

130. A patient complains of acute increase in diuresis (up to 5-7 liters of urine per 24 hours). Examination revealed decreased secretion of vasopressin in this patient.   What cells have insufficient secretory activity in this case?

answers.text: A. Endocrinocytes  of the anterior pituitary
C. Neurosecretory cells of the hypothalamus
D. Endocrinocytes    of the intermediate pituitary

questions.question: 131. A 4-year-old child died   of cardiopulmonary failure. Autopsy shows dense pancreas; there are obturative atelectasis   and bronchiectases in the bronchi and fatty liver infiltration. Microscopy of the cystically dilated ducts, atrophy of the    glandular parenchyma, diffuse fibrosis, and lymphohistiocytic   infiltration. What is the most likely diagnosis? pancreas shows
132. Coronary artery   thrombosis resulted in   development of myocardial infarction.   What mechanisms of cell damage are leading in this disease?

133. A 50-year-old woman with a long history of glomerulonephritis died with  progressing  signs of intoxication (uremia). Autopsy shows thickened wall of the large intestine, with a gray-white film on the mucosa. The film is tightly attached to the underlying tissues. On the pleura there are grayish films that can be easily removed. What type of inflammation can be observed?

answers.text: A. In the large intestine - serous catarrh, on the pleura - croupous inflammation
B. In the large intestine - suppurative inflammation, on the pleura - diphtheritic inflammation
C. In the large intestine - diphtheritic inflammation, on the pleura - croupous inflammation
D. In the large intestine - croupous inflammation, on the pleura - diphtheritic inflammation
E. In the large intestine - suppurative inflammation, on the pleura - croupous inflammation

questions.question: 134. Histological specimen shows organ parenchyma that consists of lymphoid tissue and forms lymph nodules. The nodules are located diffusely and have a central artery. What anatomical structure has such     morphological characteristics?

135. A man with constant headaches, pain in the occipital region, tinnitus,  dizziness has been admitted  to the cardiology department. Objectively, his blood pressire is 180/110 mm Hg, heart rate is 95/min. Radiographically, there is a stenosis of one of the renal arteries.  Hypertensive condition in this patient has been caused by the activation of the following system:
136. A 60-year-old man with chronic hepatitis  frequently develops nosebleeds and bleeding gums; hemorrhagic rash spontaneously develops on his skin and mucosa. What is the cause of these phenomena?

answers.text: A. Decreased formation of serum albumins
C. Appearance  of macroglobulins and cryoglobulins in the blood
D. Decreased blood levels of choline esterase
E. Decreased    synthesis of prothrombin and fibrinogen

questions.question: 137. Due to a case of diphtheria, preventive immunization of the whole contact group of students is necessary.  What preparation should  be used to produce  artificial   active immunity?
138. A patient demonstrates functional loss of nasal halves of the retinas. What area of visual pathways is affected?

139. A 15-year-old teenager complains of general weakness, dizziness, and rapid    fatigability. Examination detected deformed erythrocytes, their number is decreased.  The provisional diagnosis of sickle-cell anemia was made. What amino acid replacement in hemoglobin causes the   development of this pathological condition?

answers.text: A. Valine replaced with aspartate cardiac rhythm

questions.question: 140. An infant, who was on synthetic formula feeding, developed signs of vitamin B1 deficiency. What reactions does this vitamin take part in?

141. Initial inoculation of water in 1% peptone water resulted in growth of a thin film on the medium surface in 6 hours. Such cultural properties are characteristic of the causative agent of the following disesase:

142. Hematologic study shows the following pattern: erythrocytes - 2.8 · 1012/L, Hb - 80 g/L. color index - 0.85, reticulocytes - 0.1%, platelets - 160 thousand per microliter, leukocytes 60 - 10/L.
